metadata.title: CVE-2015-8380 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The pcre_exec function in pcre_exec.c in PCRE before 8.38 mishandles a //pattern with a \01 string, which allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted regular expression, as demonstrated by a JavaScriptRegExp object encountered by Konqueror.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8380` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2').
